cards.name: Hint of Insanity
cards.text: Target player reveals their hand. That player discards all nonland cards with the same name as another card in their hand.
cards.flavor: "Practice makes perfect, but obsession makes better."

rulings.text: If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

cards.originalText: Target player reveals his or her hand. That player discards from it all nonland cards with the same name as another card in his or her hand.

cards.name: Infected Vermin
cards.text:
{2}{B}: Infected Vermin deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
Threshold — {3}{B}: Infected Vermin deals 3 damage to each creature and each player. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.originalText:
{2}{B}: Infected Vermin deals 1 damage to each creature and each player. 
Threshold {3}{B}: Infected Vermin deals 3 damage to each creature and each player. (Play this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Innocent Blood
cards.text: Each player sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor: Zombies mourn for the living and celebrate those who will soon be given the gift of death.

rulings.text: You can cast Innocent Blood even if some (or all) players control no creatures. Those players are simply unaffected.

cards.originalText: Each player sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Last Rites
cards.text: Discard any number of cards. Target player reveals their hand, then you choose a nonland card from it for each card discarded this way. That player discards those cards.
cards.originalText: Discard any number of cards from your hand. Target player reveals his or her hand, then you choose a nonland card from it for each card discarded this way. That player discards those cards.

cards.name: Malevolent Awakening
cards.text: {1}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: The most popular pit fighters are brought back for encore performances.
cards.originalText: {1}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Mind Burst
cards.text: Target player discards X cards, where X is one plus the number of cards named Mind Burst in all graveyards.
cards.flavor: As haunting as a zombie's curse.
cards.originalText: Target player discards X cards from his or her hand, where X is one plus the number of Mind Burst cards in all graveyards.

cards.name: Mindslicer
cards.text: When Mindslicer dies, each player discards their hand.
cards.flavor: It is the thing that goes bump in the night.
cards.originalText: When Mindslicer is put into a graveyard from play, each player discards his or her hand.

cards.name: Morbid Hunger
cards.text:
Morbid Hunger deals 3 damage to any target. You gain 3 life.
Flashback {7}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Morbid Hunger deals 3 damage to target creature or player. You gain 3 life.
Flashback {7}{B}{B} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Morgue Theft
cards.text:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Flashback {4}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Flashback {4}{B} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Mortivore
cards.text:
Mortivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
{B}: Regenerate Mortivore.
cards.originalText:
Mortivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
{B}: Regenerate Mortivore.

cards.name: Nefarious Lich
cards.text:
If damage would be dealt to you, exile that many cards from your graveyard instead. If you can't, you lose the game.
If you would gain life, draw that many cards instead.
When Nefarious Lich leaves the battlefield, you lose the game.

rulings.text: If you were going to gain life and you also have a replacement that can turn card drawing into life gain on the battlefield, you can gain life by using the Lich to turn the original life gain into card drawing, and then using the other replacement to turn a card draw into life gain. Nefarious Lich will not replace the life gain with a card draw again because it has already acted on this event.
This card will not prevent you from losing the game due to zero or less life.

cards.originalText:
If you would be dealt damage, remove that many cards in your graveyard from the game instead. If you can't, you lose the game.
If you would gain life, draw that many cards instead.
When Nefarious Lich leaves play, you lose the game.

cards.name: Overeager Apprentice
cards.text: Discard a card, Sacrifice Overeager Apprentice: Add {B}{B}{B}.
cards.flavor: Slow and steady may not always win the race, but at least it doesn't end up splattered on the walls.
cards.originalText: Discard a card from your hand, Sacrifice Overeager Apprentice: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Painbringer
cards.text: {T}, Exile any number of cards from your graveyard: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards exiled this way.
cards.originalText: {T}, Remove any number of cards in your graveyard from the game: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards removed this way.

cards.name: Patriarch's Desire
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/-2.
Threshold — Enchanted creature gets an additional +2/-2 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +2/-2.
Threshold Enchanted creature gets an additional +2/-2. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Repentant Vampire
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Repentant Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Repentant Vampire.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Repentant Vampire is white and has "{T}: Destroy target black creature."

rulings.text: If Threshold is met, this card is white. It is not white and black.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Repentant Vampire this turn is put into a graveyard, put a +1/+1 counter on Repentant Vampire.
Threshold Repentant Vampire is white and has "{T}: Destroy target black creature."

cards.name: Rotting Giant
cards.text: Whenever Rotting Giant attacks or blocks, sacrifice it unless you exile a card from your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Wracked with rot, it wrecks and ruins.
cards.originalText: Whenever Rotting Giant attacks or blocks, sacrifice it unless you remove a card in your graveyard from the game.

cards.name: Sadistic Hypnotist
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Target player discards two cards. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor: "Victory in the pits is almost as rewarding as the methods I use to achieve it."

rulings.text: If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you'll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Target player discards two cards from his or her hand. Play this ability only any time you could play a sorcery.

cards.name: Screams of the Damned
cards.text: {1}{B}, Exile a card from your graveyard: Screams of the Damned deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: It's important to face your inner demons . . . unless they're the kind of demons that can kill you.
cards.originalText: {1}{B}, Remove a card in your graveyard from the game: Screams of the Damned deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Skeletal Scrying
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile X cards from your graveyard.
You draw X cards and you lose X life.
cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Skeletal Scrying, remove X cards in your graveyard from the game.
You draw X cards and you lose X life.

cards.name: Skull Fracture
cards.text:
Target player discards a card.
Flashback {3}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Target player discards a card from his or her hand.
Flashback {3}{B} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Stalking Bloodsucker
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{B}, Discard a card: Stalking Bloodsucker gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The pits feed both its thirst for combat and its thirst for blood.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{B}, Discard a card from your hand: Stalking Bloodsucker gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Tainted Pact
cards.text: Exile the top card of your library. You may put that card into your hand unless it has the same name as another card exiled this way. Repeat this process until you put a card into your hand or you exile two cards with the same name, whichever comes first.
cards.originalText: Remove the top card of your library from the game. You may put that card into your hand unless it has the same name as another card removed this way. Repeat this process until you put a card into your hand or you remove two cards with the same name, whichever comes first.

cards.name: Tombfire
cards.text: Target player exiles all cards with flashback from their graveyard.
cards.flavor: The fondest memories burn brightest. As they're lost forever, the flames grow hotter still.
cards.originalText: Target player removes all cards with flashback in his or her graveyard from the game.

cards.name: Traveling Plague
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of each upkeep, put a plague counter on Traveling Plague.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 for each plague counter on Traveling Plague.
When enchanted creature leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller returns Traveling Plague from its owner's graveyard to the battlefield.

rulings.text: A counter is placed on every player's upkeep, not just the controller's upkeep.
The controller of the dead creature chooses the new creature.

When the enchanted creature leaves the battlefield, this card is placed into the graveyard as is normal for an Aura when it loses what it enchants. The triggered ability returns this card to the battlefield with no counters on it.
In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, put a plague counter on Traveling Plague.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 for each plague counter on Traveling Plague.
When enchanted creature leaves play, that creature's controller returns Traveling Plague from its owner's graveyard to play.

cards.name: Whispering Shade
cards.text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
{B}: Whispering Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It glides through the shadows until it reaches yours.
cards.originalText:
Swampwalk
{B}: Whispering Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Zombie Assassin
cards.text: {T}, Exile two cards from your graveyard and Zombie Assassin: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"Zombies don't kill. They recruit."
—Braids, dementia summoner
cards.originalText: {T}, Remove two cards in your graveyard and Zombie Assassin from the game: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Zombie Cannibal
cards.text: Whenever Zombie Cannibal deals combat damage to a player, you may exile target card from that player's graveyard.
cards.flavor: Nothing is sacred to the undead—not even their own kind.
cards.originalText: Whenever Zombie Cannibal deals combat damage to a player, you may remove target card in that player's graveyard from the game.

cards.name: Zombie Infestation
cards.text: Discard two cards: Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
cards.flavor: The nomads' funeral pyres are more practical than ceremonial.
cards.originalText: Discard two cards from your hand: Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token into play.

cards.name: Zombify
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"The first birth celebrates life. The second birth mocks it."
—Mystic elder
cards.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to play.

cards.name: Acceptable Losses
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card at random.
Acceptable Losses deals 5 damage to target creature.
cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Acceptable Losses, discard a card at random from your hand.
Acceptable Losses deals 5 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Anarchist
cards.text: When Anarchist enters the battlefield, you may return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Those who will not follow are doomed to lead.
cards.originalText: When Anarchist comes into play, you may return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Ashen Firebeast
cards.text: {1}{R}: Ashen Firebeast deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
cards.flavor:
"I'm not sure which impresses me most, its thoroughness or its intensity."
—Matoc, lavamancer
cards.originalText: {1}{R}: Ashen Firebeast deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.

cards.name: Barbarian Lunatic
cards.text: {2}{R}, Sacrifice Barbarian Lunatic: It deals 2 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor:
"I once saw a single barbarian charge a band of twenty nomads. I've seen some crazy ones, too."
—Nomad sentry
cards.originalText: {2}{R}, Sacrifice Barbarian Lunatic: Barbarian Lunatic deals 2 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Bash to Bits
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact.
Flashback {4}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Destroy target artifact.
Flashback {4}{R}{R} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Battle Strain
cards.text: Whenever a creature blocks, Battle Strain deals 1 damage to that creature's controller.
cards.flavor: The pits swallow the weak as predators swallow prey.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature blocks, Battle Strain deals 1 damage to that creature's controller.

cards.name: Blazing Salvo
cards.text: Blazing Salvo deals 3 damage to target creature unless that creature's controller has Blazing Salvo deal 5 damage to them.
cards.flavor: Barbarians equate courage with the ability to endure pain.
cards.originalText: Blazing Salvo deals 3 damage to target creature unless that creature's controller has Blazing Salvo deal 5 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Bomb Squad
cards.text:
{T}: Put a fuse counter on target creature.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a fuse counter on each creature with a fuse counter on it.
Whenever a creature has four or more fuse counters on it, remove all fuse counters from it and destroy it. That creature deals 4 damage to its controller.

rulings.text: If the creature regenerates, the fuse counters are still removed and the four damage is still dealt.

If there are two Bomb Squads on the battlefield when a creature ends up with 4 or more fuse counters, both Bomb Squad abilities will trigger causing 4 damage each even though the first to resolve will destroy the creature.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Put a fuse counter on target creature.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a fuse counter on each creature with a fuse counter on it.
Whenever a creature has four or more fuse counters on it, remove all fuse counters from it and destroy it. That creature deals 4 damage to its controller.

cards.name: Burning Sands
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller sacrifices a land.
cards.flavor:
"Pain teaches lessons no scholar can."
—Kamahl, pit fighter
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from play, that creature's controller sacrifices a land.

cards.name: Chainflinger
cards.text:
{1}{R}, {T}: Chainflinger deals 1 damage to any target.
Threshold — {2}{R}, {T}: Chainflinger deals 2 damage to any target. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.originalText:
{1}{R}, {T}: Chainflinger deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Threshold {2}{R}, {T}: Chainflinger deals 2 damage to target creature or player. (Play this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Chance Encounter
cards.text:
Whenever you win a coin flip, put a luck counter on Chance Encounter.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Chance Encounter has ten or more luck counters on it, you win the game.
cards.flavor: The more unlikely the victory, the more memorable the success.

rulings.text: You can only win a coin flip if you are the player flipping the coin. Your opponent losing a flip does not count as you winning one. This is a reversal of previous rulings.

cards.originalText:
Whenever you win a coin flip, put a luck counter on Chance Encounter.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Chance Encounter has ten or more luck counters on it, you win the game.

cards.name: Demolish
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or land.
cards.flavor:
"Pound the steel until it fits.
Doesn't work? Bash to bits."
—Dwarven forging song
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or land.

cards.name: Demoralize
cards.text:
All creatures gain menace until end of turn. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Threshold — If seven or more cards are in your graveyard, creatures can't block this turn.
cards.originalText:
Each creature can't be blocked this turn except by two or more creatures. 
Threshold Creatures can't block this turn. (You have threshold if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Dwarven Grunt
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor:
Hard as stone and twice as stubborn.
—Dwarven compliment
cards.originalText: Mountainwalk

cards.name: Dwarven Recruiter
cards.text: When Dwarven Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for any number of Dwarf cards and reveal those cards. Shuffle your library, then put them on top of it in any order.
cards.originalText: When Dwarven Recruiter comes into play, search your library for any number of Dwarf cards and reveal those cards. Shuffle your library, then put them on top of it in any order.

cards.name: Dwarven Shrine
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, Dwarven Shrine deals X damage to that player, where X is twice the number of cards in all graveyards with the same name as that spell.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a spell, Dwarven Shrine deals X damage to that player, where X is twice the number of cards in all graveyards with the same name as that spell.

cards.name: Dwarven Strike Force
cards.text: Discard a card at random: Dwarven Strike Force gains first strike and haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Any given foothill may hide dozens of dwarves waiting to spill from their tunnels like fire ants.
cards.originalText: Discard a card at random from your hand: Dwarven Strike Force gains first strike and haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Earth Rift
cards.text:
Destroy target land.
Flashback {5}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Destroy target land.
Flashback {5}{R}{R} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Ember Beast
cards.text: Ember Beast can't attack or block alone.
cards.flavor:
Spot one ember beast, attack.
Spot a second, best fall back.
—Dwarven saying

rulings.text: Ember Beast can't attack or block unless another creature is also assigned to attack or block at the same time. Notably, two Ember Beasts can attack or block together.
Once Ember Beast has been declared as an attacker or blocker, it doesn't matter what happens to the other creature(s).

Other creatures assigned to attack alongside Ember Beast don't have to attack the same player or planeswalker. Other creatures assigned to block alongside Ember Beast don't have to block the same creature as Ember Beast.

cards.originalText: Ember Beast can't attack or block alone.

cards.name: Engulfing Flames
cards.text:
Engulfing Flames deals 1 damage to target creature. It can't be regenerated this turn.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Engulfing Flames deals 1 damage to target creature. It can't be regenerated this turn.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Epicenter
cards.text:
Target player sacrifices a land.
Threshold — Each player sacrifices all lands they control instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Sometimes destruction is Dominaria's way of rebuilding. Sometimes it's not.
cards.originalText:
Target player sacrifices a land.
Threshold All players sacrifice all lands instead. (You have threshold if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Firebolt
cards.text:
Firebolt deals 2 damage to any target.
Flashback {4}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: Reach out and torch someone.
cards.originalText:
Firebolt deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
Flashback {4}{R} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Flame Burst
cards.text: Flame Burst deals X damage to any target, where X is 2 plus the number of cards named Flame Burst in all graveyards.
cards.flavor: As hot as a dwarf's rage.
cards.originalText: Flame Burst deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is 2 plus the number of Flame Burst cards in all graveyards.

cards.name: Frenetic Ogre
cards.text: {R}, Discard a card at random: Frenetic Ogre gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The best thing about ogres is that they never try to sneak up on you.
cards.originalText: {R}, Discard a card at random from your hand: Frenetic Ogre gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Halberdier
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor: His reputation precedes him—and so does his weapon.
cards.originalText: First strike

cards.name: Impulsive Maneuvers
cards.text: Whenever a creature attacks, flip a coin. If you win the flip, the next time that creature would deal combat damage this turn, it deals double that damage instead. If you lose the flip, the next time that creature would deal combat damage this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: You flip a coin for each creature that attacks, not once per attack.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature attacks, flip a coin. If you win the flip, the next time that creature would deal combat damage this turn, it deals double that damage instead. If you lose the flip, the next time that creature would deal combat damage this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Kamahl, Pit Fighter
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
{T}: Kamahl, Pit Fighter deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: "I didn't come to play. I came to win."

rulings.text: The Legend rule only applies to two legendary permanents with identical names. If the names are different, even if they depict the same character, the rule does not apply.

cards.originalText:
Haste
{T}: Kamahl, Pit Fighter deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Kamahl's Desire
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has first strike.
Threshold — Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature has first strike. 
Threshold Enchanted creature gets +3/+0. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Lava Blister
cards.text: Destroy target nonbasic land unless its controller has Lava Blister deal 6 damage to them.
cards.flavor:
To treat flesh wounds, use earth. To treat earth wounds, use flesh.
—Barbarian saying
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonbasic land unless its controller has Lava Blister deal 6 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Liquid Fire
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, choose a number between 0 and 5.
Liquid Fire deals X damage to target creature and 5 minus X damage to that creature's controller, where X is the chosen number.
cards.flavor: There's no such thing as a little bit of lava.

rulings.text: You choose the number as you cast the spell. If you choose 0, the creature's controller will be dealt 5 damage. If you choose 5, that player will not be dealt any damage.

cards.originalText: Liquid Fire deals 5 damage divided as you choose between target creature and that creature's controller.

cards.name: Mad Dog
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, if Mad Dog didn't attack or come under your control this turn, sacrifice it.
cards.flavor: The bones it buries may be yours.
cards.originalText: At the end of your turn, if Mad Dog didn't attack or come under your control this turn, sacrifice it.

cards.name: Magma Vein
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice a land: Magma Vein deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
cards.flavor:
Standing near a volcano
—Barbarian expression meaning
"asking for it"
cards.originalText: {R}, Sacrifice a land: Magma Vein deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.

cards.name: Magnivore
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Magnivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of sorcery cards in all graveyards.
cards.originalText:
Haste
Magnivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of sorcery cards in all graveyards.

cards.name: Mine Layer
cards.text:
{1}{R}, {T}: Put a mine counter on target land.
Whenever a land with a mine counter on it becomes tapped, destroy it.
When Mine Layer leaves the battlefield, remove all mine counters from all lands.
cards.originalText:
{1}{R}, {T}: Put a mine counter on target land.
Whenever a land with a mine counter on it becomes tapped, destroy it.
When Mine Layer leaves play, remove all mine counters from all lands.

cards.name: Minotaur Explorer
cards.text: When Minotaur Explorer enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random.
cards.flavor: After the invasion devastated the Talruum and Hurloon tribes, the survivors began to search for other minotaurs.
cards.originalText: When Minotaur Explorer comes into play, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random from your hand.

cards.name: Molten Influence
cards.text: Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller has Molten Influence deal 4 damage to them.
cards.flavor: Lavamancers make simple requests: obey or die.
cards.originalText: Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller has Molten Influence deal 4 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Mudhole
cards.text: Target player exiles all land cards from their graveyard.
cards.flavor: "Doing okay back there, Tarv? Tarv?"
cards.originalText: Target player removes all land cards in his or her graveyard from the game.

cards.name: Need for Speed
cards.text: Sacrifice a land: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: His feet buckled the ground, his hands cut the wind to ribbons, and he was gone.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a land: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Obstinate Familiar
cards.text: If you would draw a card, you may skip that draw instead.
cards.flavor:
"Lizards make excellent familiars. They never know when they've lost."
—Matoc, lavamancer
cards.originalText: If you would draw a card, you may skip that draw instead.

cards.name: Pardic Firecat
cards.text:
Haste
If Pardic Firecat is in a graveyard, effects from spells named Flame Burst count it as a card named Flame Burst.
cards.flavor:
"I've heard of putting the cat out, but this isn't what I had in mind."
—Nomad sentry
cards.originalText:
Haste
If Pardic Firecat is in a graveyard, Flame Burst's effect counts it as a Flame Burst.

cards.name: Pardic Miner
cards.text: Sacrifice Pardic Miner: Target player can't play lands this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Punch and drag,
Toss the slag,
Sift the soil,
Leave the spoil."

rulings.text: The ability won't stop lands from being put onto the battlefield by a spell or ability.
The ability won't stop players from activating the abilities of lands. It only stops land cards from being played.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice Pardic Miner: Target player can't play lands this turn.

cards.name: Pardic Swordsmith
cards.text: {R}, Discard a card at random: Pardic Swordsmith gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A finely crafted blade will never meet as many blows on the battlefield as it did on the anvil.
cards.originalText: {R}, Discard a card at random from your hand: Pardic Swordsmith gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Price of Glory
cards.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, if it's not that player's turn, destroy that land.
cards.flavor:
"True strength lies in action. Let the weak react to me."
—Kamahl, pit fighter
cards.originalText: Whenever a player taps a land for mana during another player's turn, destroy that land.

cards.name: Reckless Charge
cards.text:
Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Recoup
cards.text:
Target sorcery card in your graveyard gains flashback until end of turn. The flashback cost is equal to its mana cost. (Mana cost includes color.)
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Target sorcery card in your graveyard gains flashback until end of turn. Its flashback cost is equal to its mana cost. (Mana cost includes color.)
Flashback {3}{R} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Rites of Initiation
cards.text: Discard any number of cards at random. Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn for each card discarded this way.
cards.originalText: Discard any number of cards at random from your hand. Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn for each card discarded this way.

cards.name: Savage Firecat
cards.text:
Trample
Savage Firecat enters the battlefield with seven +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever you tap a land for mana, remove a +1/+1 counter from Savage Firecat.
cards.originalText:
Trample
Savage Firecat comes into play with seven +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever you tap a land for mana, remove a +1/+1 counter from Savage Firecat.

cards.name: Scorching Missile
cards.text:
Scorching Missile deals 4 damage to target player or planeswalker.
Flashback {9}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Scorching Missile deals 4 damage to target player.
Flashback {9}{R} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Seize the Day
cards.text:
Untap target creature. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

rulings.text: It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

cards.originalText:
Untap target creature. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Shower of Coals
cards.text:
Shower of Coals deals 2 damage to each of up to three targets.
Threshold — Shower of Coals deals 4 damage to each of those permanents and/or players instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.originalText:
Shower of Coals deals 2 damage to each of up to three target creatures and/or players.
Threshold Shower of Coals deals 4 damage to each of those creatures and/or players instead. (You have threshold if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Spark Mage
cards.text: Whenever Spark Mage deals combat damage to a player, you may have Spark Mage deal 1 damage to target creature that player controls.
cards.flavor: The Pardic Mountains are known for their spicy cuisine.
cards.originalText: Whenever Spark Mage deals combat damage to a player, you may have Spark Mage deal 1 damage to target creature that player controls.

cards.name: Steam Vines
cards.text:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it and Steam Vines deals 1 damage to that land's controller. That player attaches Steam Vines to a land of their choice.

rulings.text: If this card leaves the battlefield after it triggers but before it resolves, then the trigger will deal damage and destroy the land, but it will not bring this card back to the battlefield.
Moving this card to another land does not target the land.
If there are no other lands to move it to, this card goes to the graveyard as would any Aura that lost the thing it enchants.

cards.originalText: When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it and Steam Vines deals 1 damage to that land's controller. That player moves Steam Vines to a land of his or her choice.

cards.name: Thermal Blast
cards.text:
Thermal Blast deals 3 damage to target creature.
Threshold — Thermal Blast deals 5 damage to that creature instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.originalText:
Thermal Blast deals 3 damage to target creature.
Threshold Thermal Blast deals 5 damage to that creature instead. (You have threshold if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Tremble
cards.text: Each player sacrifices a land.
cards.flavor: Otaria's frequent tremors are the last stages of Dominaria's recovery from the Phyrexian war.
cards.originalText: Each player sacrifices a land.

cards.name: Volcanic Spray
cards.text:
Volcanic Spray deals 1 damage to each creature without flying and each player.
Flashback {1}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Volcanic Spray deals 1 damage to each creature without flying and each player.
Flashback {1}{R} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Volley of Boulders
cards.text:
Volley of Boulders deals 6 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.
Flashback {R}{R}{R}{R}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

rulings.text: You can't choose zero targets. You must choose between 1 and 6 targets.

cards.originalText:
Volley of Boulders deals 6 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
Flashback {R}{R}{R}{R}{R}{R} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Whipkeeper
cards.text: {T}: Whipkeeper deals damage to target creature equal to the damage already dealt to it this turn.
cards.flavor: "If you don't hit your adversaries while they're down, they might get up again."

rulings.text: If the creature regenerated during the turn, and thereby had all damage on it removed, the damage before it regenerated was still dealt that turn and will be counted.
This counts all damage that was dealt during the turn. This does not include any damage that was prevented.

cards.originalText: {T}: Whipkeeper deals damage to target creature equal to the damage already dealt to it this turn.

cards.name: Bearscape
cards.text: {1}{G}, Exile two cards from your graveyard: Create a 2/2 green Bear creature token.
cards.flavor:
"Nature is the endless dance between life and death."
—Seton, centaur druid
cards.originalText: {1}{G}, Remove two cards in your graveyard from the game: Put a 2/2 green Bear creature token into play.

cards.name: Beast Attack
cards.text:
Create a 4/4 green Beast creature token.
Flashback {2}{G}{G}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Put a 4/4 green Beast creature token into play.
Flashback {2}{G}{G}{G} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Call of the Herd
cards.text:
Create a 3/3 green Elephant creature token.
Flashback {3}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Put a 3/3 green Elephant creature token into play.
Flashback {3}{G} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Cartographer
cards.text: When Cartographer enters the battlefield, you may return target land card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: "Finding the way once is luck. Finding the way twice takes a good map."
cards.originalText: When Cartographer comes into play, you may return target land card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Chatter of the Squirrel
cards.text:
Create a 1/1 green Squirrel creature token.
Flashback {1}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Put a 1/1 green Squirrel creature token into play.
Flashback {1}{G} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Chlorophant
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Chlorophant.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Chlorophant has "At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put another +1/+1 counter on Chlorophant."
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Chlorophant.
Threshold At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put another +1/+1 counter on Chlorophant. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Crashing Centaur
cards.text:
{G}, Discard a card: Crashing Centaur gains trample until end of turn.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Crashing Centaur gets +2/+2 and has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.originalText:
{G}, Discard a card from your hand: Crashing Centaur gains trample until end of turn.
Threshold Crashing Centaur gets +2/+2 and can't be the target of spells or abilities. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Deep Reconnaissance
cards.text:
Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
Flashback {4}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play tapped. Then shuffle your library.
Flashback {4}{G} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Diligent Farmhand
cards.text:
{1}{G}, Sacrifice Diligent Farmhand: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
If Diligent Farmhand is in a graveyard, effects from spells named Muscle Burst count it as a card named Muscle Burst.
cards.originalText:
{1}{G}, Sacrifice Diligent Farmhand: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play tapped. Then shuffle your library.
If Diligent Farmhand is in a graveyard, Muscle Burst's effect counts it as a Muscle Burst.

cards.name: Druid Lyrist
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Druid Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor: The druids and the forest are in perfect harmony. They sing the same songs.
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Druid Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Druid's Call
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature is dealt damage, its controller creates that many 1/1 green Squirrel creature tokens.
cards.flavor: Suffer the little creatures, for they may yet rise up and beat you senseless.
cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted creature is dealt damage, its controller puts that many 1/1 green Squirrel creature tokens into play.

cards.name: Elephant Ambush
cards.text:
Create a 3/3 green Elephant creature token.
Flashback {6}{G}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Put a 3/3 green Elephant creature token into play.
Flashback {6}{G}{G} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Gorilla Titan
cards.text:
Trample
Gorilla Titan gets +4/+4 as long as there are no cards in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: "I want a banana this big!"
cards.originalText:
Trample  
Gorilla Titan gets +4/+4 as long as there are no cards in your graveyard.

cards.name: Ground Seal
cards.text:
When Ground Seal enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Cards in graveyards can't be the targets of spells or abilities.
cards.flavor:
"Let all we have buried be buried forever."
—Seton, centaur druid

rulings.text: The last ability only works when Ground Seal is on the battlefield.
Only spells and abilities that target cards in graveyards will be affected. Abilities that don't target cards in graveyards (like the one Tormod's Crypt has) can still affect those cards.

cards.originalText:
When Ground Seal comes into play, draw a card.
Cards in graveyards can't be the targets of spells or abilities.
